alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 3:44PM MST until August 23 at 6:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 645 PM MST. * At 344 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the area from the intersection of I-40 and US 93 to Blake Ranch Road and also the southeast portion of Hualapai Mountain including the old Dean Peak Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blake Ranch Road and also the southeast portion of Hualapai Mountain. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
